alert.note: Alert for Western Okanogan County (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 06 at 10:04AM PST until January 07 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...HEAVY SNOW AND FREEZING RAIN TODAY CONTINUING OVER MOST AREAS THROUGH THIS EVENING WITH THE THREAT OF HEAVY SNOW CONTINUING OVER THE MOUNTAINS THROUGH FRIDAY... ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST FRIDAY... ...WINTER STORM WARNING HAS EXPIRED... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations between 2 and 4 inches for the lower Methow Valley and 3 to 7 inches for Mazama. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Winthrop, Methow, Twisp, Mazama, Conconully, and Loup Loup Pass. * WHEN...Until 10 AM PST Friday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the Thursday evening and Friday morning commutes.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
